definition: lit. "Why don't they eat meat?" (said by Emperor Hui of Jin 晉惠帝|晋惠帝[Jin4 Hui4 di4] when told that his people didn't have enough rice to eat)/fig. (of people from higher class etc) to be oblivious to other people's plight

sentences.english: Stronger is useless, why not Lele eyes?
sentences.chinese: 要強既是沒用，何不樂樂眼前呢？

sentences.english: Why not serve a piece of each?
sentences.chinese: 何不兩條魚各上一塊呢？

sentences.english: Why don't we （crack）open a bottle of champagne to celebrate?
sentences.chinese: 我們何不開瓶香檳酒慶祝一下呢？

sentences.english: "Why not serve a piece of each?" she suggested.
sentences.chinese: “何不兩條魚各上一塊呢？”他妻子建議道。

sentences.english: Hey son, why don't you pull up one of those empty chairs?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，年輕人，你何不拉張沒人坐的椅子。

sentences.english: Why do not you steam those lobsters with ginger and scallion now ?
sentences.chinese: 你現在何不把那些龍蝦和姜，蔥一起蒸呢？

sentences.english: Why don't we crack open a bottle of champagner to celebrate?
sentences.chinese: 我們何不開瓶香擯酒慶祝一下呢？

sentences.english: You haven't touched a thing . What's wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你一點東西也沒碰過，有何不妥？

sentences.english: Why not share your thoughts in the comments below?
sentences.chinese: 何不在下面的評論欄上分享你的想法呢？

sentences.english: Why dont we have lunch at Charleys?
sentences.chinese: 我們何不去查理飯店喫午餐呢？

sentences.english: When the table is "open", any object ball not legally pocketed remains off the table.
sentences.chinese: 在球局開放時任何不合法入袋的目標球均不必取出。

sentences.english: Mo of the very evil people in the dead, then why not for patients who can be provided also?
sentences.chinese: 使人之所惡莫甚於死者，則凡可以闢患者何不爲也？

sentences.english: Why not stop the encore now?
sentences.chinese: 現在就停止這個再來有何不可？

sentences.english: I like loneliness patients . Why not?
sentences.chinese: 我像個孤獨患者。有何不可？

sentences.english: You think I should understand, what I do not know miss know.
sentences.chinese: 你自認爲懂我，應何不知錯過便了然。

sentences.english: As their boss, why not just remind them?
sentences.chinese: 作爲他們的上司，何不直接提醒他們呢？

definition: what harm is there in (doing sth)
not as good as/not equal to/inferior
to hinder/(in the negative or interrogative) (no) harm/(what) harm
why bother?/is it worth the trouble?
no harm (in doing it)/One might as well./It won't hurt./no matter/it's no bother
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
